item.title: Fully optimized and cleaned RSCDv25 www (no-forums included)
item.dc:creator: @sw0o0sh sw0o0sh
item.description:
@sw0o0sh wrote:

Clearing the cache and then altering the config table via phpmyadmin worked flawlessly for me, so I’m not entirely sure what you’re not getting. Though there are other ways, such as a clean install for instance. Flush the cache folder, delete the Fluxbb related tables from your phpmyadmin, delete the “config.php” file from the forum folder, and then run install.php for a clean install of the Flux forum

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Vicd Vicd
item.description:
@Vicd wrote:

I did it, does not help.

Now I can’t do shit tbh, I tried to change it back to your email and it says:
“The admin e-mail address you entered is invalid.”
Even if I’m not trying to change the email.

On server database I have:
sw0o0sh@msn.com
On the Admin options I have:
sw0o0sh@msn.com
Cache is cleared.

item.source: Fully optimized and cleaned RSCDv25 www (no-forums included)

item.title: Fully optimized and cleaned RSCDv25 www (no-forums included)
item.dc:creator: @sw0o0sh sw0o0sh
item.description:
@sw0o0sh wrote:

Next best thing to do would be to

  1. empty your forum/cache/ folder.
  2. go to phpmyadmin/ or whatever SQL management program you use
  3. go to the config table in your forum database
  4. search for ‘o_admin_email’ & ‘o_webmaster_email’ and modify it to your email. Also this is where you’d fix the referer if you haven’t already

Read full topic

item.title: Fully optimized and cleaned RSCDv25 www (no-forums included)
item.dc:creator: @Peopleknowme Peopleknowme
item.description:
@Peopleknowme wrote:

I keep getting this Bad HTTP_REFERER. If you have moved these forums from one location to another or switched domains, you need to update the Base URL manually in the database (look for o_base_url in the config table) and then clear the cache by deleting all .php files in the /cache directory.

Im running wamp, Before i imported the .sql Database i changed the base_url to http://localhost and i’ve deleted the .php files in c:\wamp\www\forum\cache. When ever i tried to edit and save any changes on the forums im constantly prompted with this error. Anyone have any ideas how to fix this? Thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: Fully optimized and cleaned RSCDv25 www (no-forums included)
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:4, topic:339804”]It can be done but I’m struggling to get it to do it much quicker, so the route I’m going down now is making a dedicated highscores table that updates every 3 hours with a structure like:

user | username | owner | skill_total | skill_total_rank | combat | combat_rank | total_xp | total_xp_rank | kills | kills_rank | death | death_rank | kill_death | kill_death_rank | attack_xp | attack_rank | defense_xp | defense_rank | strength_xp | strength_rank … etc

Then there’s no calculation needed and it just pulls it from the database in milliseconds. There will be a ~2 second pause every 3-6 hours updating the highscores but that’s it.[/quote]

If you’re making a table just to cache results, then there are better ways of doing it (APC would probably be the simplest).

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sw0o0sh sw0o0sh
item.description:
@sw0o0sh wrote:

I’ve taken the advice and removed the individual player-view ranking system from the prepackaged download, I tested it myself with an extra 100,000 rows in the experience table and it is dreadfully slow. Personally Kryptix, I don’t think it can be done at all in 1 query without some sort of summary table, but if you can find a way I would be truly impressed.

snoopy89:

And who can tell thats its not backdoored for yourself ? I mean thats what you did on Rsc.live right ?

There is nothing malicious in this release. It’s all open source and people are welcomed to take from it what they wish.

item.title: Fully optimized and cleaned RSCDv25 www (no-forums included)
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/table-locking.html

Something I found interesting that goes along with the discussion.

It’s kind of annoying how they say “takes a long time to run” and don’t give you any indication of what they mean by long time…

Bringing this information into the discussion…

“Table locking enables many sessions to read from a table at the same time”

I get from that, as long as an update (insert, update, delete, etc), doesn’t occur between select queries you should be fine.

Also, I don’t know the performance differences of using PHP to get the number of rows vs MySQL’s count feature/function, but you might want to look into that.

Read full topic
item.source: Fully optimized and cleaned RSCDv25 www (no-forums included)

item.title: Fully optimized and cleaned RSCDv25 www (no-forums included)
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

The point is, sw0osh, that in those 2.4 seconds the tables are LOCKED, meaning that no-one can log into the game server or access parts of the website in that time. If a malicious individual were to repeatedly refresh the page, they could effectively DoS the server.

Read full topic
item.source: Fully optimized and cleaned RSCDv25 www (no-forums included)

item.title: Fully optimized and cleaned RSCDv25 www (no-forums included)
item.dc:creator: @sw0o0sh sw0o0sh
item.description:
@sw0o0sh wrote:

There is no alternate method to doing it in a single query, given the current structure of the database (as far as I know I suppose). 18 queries isn’t always necessary if you add the restrictions I suggested in the aforementioned post, it took you 2-3 seconds when counting through 30,000 rows of players 18 times (ranking up from 0 xp implies that it will loop through the total player count). Limit it to levels 80-90 and above to be ranked, and loading time wouldn’t be an issue anymore.

And still, you haven’t linked me to official documentation that explains as to why multiple queries is a “bad thing”. I’m not saying anything, you are more than welcome to your opinions, but I would at least like to see a technical explanation coming from an authoritative source in the matter.

Read full topic
item.source: Fully optimized and cleaned RSCDv25 www (no-forums included)

item.title: Fully optimized and cleaned RSCDv25 www (no-forums included)
item.dc:creator: @sw0o0sh sw0o0sh
item.description:
@sw0o0sh wrote:

And I still think you’re a noob for arguing a point you don’t really understand. If you are truly worried about a split second in loading time, you can set the minimum amount of XP you will allow in the highscores, as JaGeX once did (level 30 and up). This would prevent it from ordering all players from 1 XP and greater. Notice the > 0 to obtain a rank count.

http://forums.devshed.com/php-development-5/using-sql-query-inside-for-loop-410748.html

[quote] you should gather all the data you need with a single query to your database and then use php to sort it out the way you need it. [/quote]

Depending on what kind of query and what kind of data processing is needed, that solution could be more resource intensive. MySQL is a compiled application, it is much faster than PHP. You would have to have some pretty extensive queries to make an impact in this particular situation.

By the way, I’ll give you 10 dollars if you can pull up an article from the SQL website explaining why running queries in a for loop is to be avoided in ALL situations.

Read full topic
item.source: Fully optimized and cleaned RSCDv25 www (no-forums included)

item.title: Fully optimized and cleaned RSCDv25 www (no-forums included)
item.dc:creator: @sw0o0sh sw0o0sh
item.description:
@sw0o0sh wrote:

Q&A

[quote=“nas92”]Hi, i tried your rscd www files which you released. However im getting an error : unable to fetch quest information
Ive read your setup tutorial but i just dont get it work.
Thanks[/quote]

You need to create a row in the users table, with the username set as “Guest”. And it says unable to fetch guest info not quest info.

(Updated May 12th/2010)

Stand alone RSCDv25 www with no forums –
http://uppit.com/v/F370RSTY
All you do is upload the SQL, add a privileged user called “global” pass “12345”, or edit in your own user @ sqlconnect.php
Keep in mind the default database is also set as “rsca”, (rsc-all).

Main WWW files w/ Forum: http://uppit.com/v/CYPEFY6H
SQL structure (needed): http://uppit.com/v/VRX1ILQH
Note - Be sure to alter the users table, you need to add a column named “sub_expires” INT(10)
Also, make sure you insert a row with the username “Guest”

Last Update: May 12, 2010

  • Removed the individual player-view ranking from the pre-packaged website
  • Added web_login table to the SQL structure, forgot to package it originally.

Special thanks to Luke of RSCEMULATION for aid in SQL and other methods.

Website Credits: 
* Essential structures, designs, and systems were coded by Sw0o0sh "Tim White".
* A special thanks to Kryptix "Luke Leary" for help ensuring website safety, and diagnosing bugs.

Website Features:

* Complies to latest web standards, XHTML 1.0 Strict, CSS based web design with SQL/PHP interaction.

* Links perfectly AND ONLY to RSCDv25 Based servers, as well as AND ONLY FLUXBB forums.

* Uses Flux_BB 1.2.22 FORUMS, latest version as of May 08, 2010
	FluxBB Is modified in the following area's to fit the websites needs:
		-------------------------------------------------------------

		(This is listed in case you want to clean install the 
		forums yourself,
		or upgrade to a new version... So make sure these changes 
		are kept in place.)

		style/imports/base.css	--> 900px wrapper.
		install.php 		--> adds "del_pin" row to DATABASE.potential_prefix.users;
		install.php		--> PUN_ROOT prefix added before install.php, to fix directory association when installing.
		include/functions.php	--> (Fixes main navigation links);
		register.php		--> Deleted. Done by website. Added security (captcha), character creation.
		login.php		--> Deleted. Done by website. Bruteforce security.

		--------------------------------------------------------------

* Allows one to host a website without any known worries of SQL injection via forums or website
	(however, always try to stay up-to-date with fluxBB)

* Fully function character management system
	- Fully external character management system (CMS), 
	instead of a hard-to-find character creation page via original RSCD forums.
	- Create, delete, and change passwords of characters flawlessly.
	- The optional feature of a character deletion pin has been added. 
	(As the name suggests, the users can not delete their characters without using
	the deletion pin, IF they decide to set one.)
	- The option of hiding oneself from the highscores.

* Highscores
	- Allows one to search anothers stats, if they are not set to hidden.
	- Allows one to view highscores for all stats and skills.
	- Fixes RSCD based highscores forum where usernames are displayed two or more times, as well.

* Tools
	- A completely PHP based Combat calculator, tested and 100% accurate.
	- Item ID List

* Server Stats

	- Displays common stats. Players online, characters, accounts.
	(NOTE: Depending on IF and HOW you fix players online via the GAMESERVER,
	this display function may not work).
	- Displays totals for RARES. This can be set off.

* Admin Features

	- Quickly count multiple server item totals, and see which items belong to who.
		( Links to user securities view bank/inventory feature )
	- Quickly view linked IP address traces/ accounts/characters, for optimum user security.
		( Allows bank / inventory viewing AND wiping via the website )
	- Set stats.
	- Set subscriptions. (An automated system is your job :] )
	- Transfering characters to different accounts.
		( Will make this public eventually )

* Plugin system

	- Coming soon, will offer the ability for users to download plugins made by me or anyone else for additional features.</blockquote>

Code preview : (highscores):

		case "highscores":
			$grabskill = isset($_GET['skill']) ? trim(strtolower($_GET['skill'])) : null;
			$search_type = isset($_GET['type']) && $_GET['type'] == 1 ? 1 : 0;
			$user_search = empty($_GET['user']) ? null : ((strlen($_GET['user']) <= 20 && $search_type == 0 || strlen($_GET['user']) <= 11 & $search_type == 1) ? $_GET['user']: null);
			echo "<form method='get' action=''><input type='hidden' name='query' value='highscores' /><input type='hidden' name='type' value='1' /><div class='table'><div class='header'>Character Search</div><div class='content'><table><tr><td style='width:30%;'>Enter character name:</td><td style='width:50%;text-align:center;'><input type='text' name='user' maxlength='11' value='" . (($search_type == 1 && isset($user_search)) ? $user_search : null) . "' /></td><td style='text-align:right;width:20%;'><input type='submit' value='Search' /></td></tr></table></div></div></form>";
			if(isset($user_search)){
				$queryLine = ($search_type == 1) ? $db->query("SELECT rscd_players.owner, rscd_players.combat, rscd_players.username, rscd_players.creation_date, rscd_players.login_date, rscd_experience.*, users.username AS 'account_name' FROM rscd_players JOIN users ON rscd_players.owner = users.id JOIN rscd_experience ON rscd_players.user = rscd_experience.user WHERE rscd_players.username = '" . $db->escape($user_search) . "' LIMIT 0 , 1") : $db->query("SELECT rscd_players.owner, rscd_players.combat, rscd_players.username, rscd_players.creation_date, rscd_players.login_date, rscd_experience.*, users.username AS 'account_name' FROM rscd_players JOIN users ON rscd_players.owner = users.id JOIN rscd_experience ON rscd_players.user = rscd_experience.user WHERE rscd_players.user = '" . $db->escape($user_search) . "' LIMIT 0 , 1");
				$userdata = $db->fetch_assoc($queryLine);
				if(isset($userdata['id'])){
					echo "<div class='table'><div class='header'>" . ucfirst($userdata['username']) . "'s Account Info</div><div class='content'><table><tr><td style='width:50%;'>Character Name</td><td>" . ucfirst($userdata['username']) . "</td></tr><tr><td style='width:50%;'>Account Name</td><td><a href='" . PUN_ROOT . "profile.php?id=" . $userdata['owner'] . "'>" . $userdata['account_name'] . "</a></td></tr><tr><td style='width:50%;'>Combat</td><td>" . $userdata['combat'] . "</td></tr><tr><td>Character Registered</td><td>" . date("M d Y", $userdata['creation_date']) . "</td></tr><tr><td>Last Login</td><td>" . date("M d Y", $userdata['login_date']) . "</td></tr></table></div></div>";
					echo "<div class='table'><div class='header'>" . ucfirst($userdata['username']) . "'s Skill Sheet</div><div class='content'><a style='display:block;text-align:right;' href='?query=highscores'>Go back to highscores?</a><br />";
					if($userdata['highscoreopt'] == 1){
						echo "This user has chose to hide their skills.";
					} else {
						echo "<table><tr><td style='width:50%;'>Skill</td><td style='width:25%;'>Level</td><td style='width:25%;'>Experience</td></tr>";
						for($i=0; $i < count($skills); $i++){

							echo"<tr><td><a href='?query=highscores&skill=" . $skills[$i] . "'><img src='" . $web_data['b_img'] . "highscores/" . $skills[$i] . ".png' alt='X' /> " . ucfirst($skills[$i]) . "</a></td><td>" . experience_to_level($userdata['exp_' . $skills[$i]]) . "</td><td>" . number_format($userdata['exp_' . $skills[$i]]) . "</td></tr>";
						}
						echo "</table>";
					}
					echo"</div></div>";
				} else {
					echo createTable("This user does not exist. <a href='?query=highscores'>Go back to highscores?</a>");
				}
			} else {
				echo "<div class='table'><div class='header'>Highscores</div><div class='content'><table>";
				for($i = 1; $i < count($skills); $i++){
						echo (($i == 1) ? "\n<tr>\n" : null) . "<td><a href='?query=highscores&skill=" . $skills[($i - 1)] . "'><img src='" . $web_data['b_img'] . "highscores/" . $skills[($i - 1)] . ".png' alt='x' />" . ucfirst($skills[($i - 1)]) . "</a></td>\n" . (($i > 0 && $i % 4 == 0) ? "\n</tr>\n<tr>\n" : null);
				}
				echo "\n<td><a href='?query=highscores&skill=skill_total'> Skill Total</a></td><td><a href='?query=highscores&skill=combat'> Combat</a></td><td> </td></tr></table></div></div>\n\n";
				if(in_array($grabskill, $skills) || $grabskill == 'combat' || $grabskill == 'skill_total'){
					(int)$startRow = isset($_GET['startrow']) && $_GET['startrow'] > 0 && $_GET['startrow'] % 20 == 0 ? $_GET['startrow'] : 0;
					$HS_QueryLine = ($grabskill == 'skill_total' ? "SELECT skill_total,user,username FROM rscd_players ORDER BY skill_total DESC" : ($grabskill == 'combat' ? "SELECT username,user,combat FROM rscd_players ORDER BY combat DESC" : "SELECT DISTINCT(rscd_experience.user), rscd_experience.highscoreopt, rscd_experience.exp_" . $grabskill . ", rscd_players.username FROM rscd_experience JOIN rscd_players ON rscd_experience.user = rscd_players.user WHERE rscd_experience.highscoreopt = 0 AND rscd_experience.exp_" . $grabskill . " > 0 ORDER BY rscd_experience.exp_" . $grabskill . " DESC"));
					$generateHSList = $db->query($HS_QueryLine . " LIMIT " . $startRow . ", 20");
					echo "<div class='table'><div class='header'><table><tr><td style='width:70%;text-align:left;'>Skill Table for " . str_replace("_", " ", ucfirst($grabskill)) . "</td><td style='width:30%;text-align:right;'><a href='?query=highscores'>Close</a></td></tr></table></div><div class='content'>";
					if($db->num_rows($generateHSList) == 0){
						echo "No results found for this particular skill.";
					} else {
						$i = $startRow + 1;
						$getTotalRows = $db->num_rows($db->query($HS_QueryLine));
						$nextUp = (($startRow - 20) < 0) ? 0 : $startRow - 20;
						$nextDown = (($startRow + 20) > $getTotalRows) ? 0 : $startRow + 20;
						echo "<table><tr><td style='width:5%;'> </td><td style='width:55%;'>Username</td>" . ($grabskill == 'skill_total' ? "<td style='width:20%;'>Skill total</td><td> </td>" : ($grabskill == 'combat' ? "<td style='width:20%;'>Combat</td><td> </td>" : "<td style='width:20%;'>Level</td><td style='width:20%;'>Experience</td>")) . "</tr><tr><td colspan='4' style='height:22px;text-align:right;'>" . (($nextUp == 0 && $nextDown == 20 || $nextUp == 0 && $nextDown == 0) ? " " : "<a href='?query=highscores&skill=" . $grabskill . "&startrow=" . $nextUp . "'><img src='" . $web_data['b_img'] . "/arrow_up.png' alt='^' /></a>") . "</td></tr>";
						while($r = $db->fetch_assoc($generateHSList)){
							echo "<tr><td>" . (($i <= 5) ? "<span style='font-weight:bold;'>" . $i . "</span>" : $i) . "</td><td><a href='?query=highscores&user=" . $r['user'] . "'>" . ucfirst($r['username']) . "</a></td> " . ($grabskill == 'skill_total' ? "<td>" . number_format($r['skill_total']) . "</td><td> </td>" : ($grabskill == 'combat' ? "<td>" . $r['combat'] . "</td><td> </td>" : "<td>" . experience_to_level($r['exp_' . $grabskill]) . "</td><td>" . number_format($r['exp_' . $grabskill]) . "</td>")) .  "</tr>";
							$i ++;
						}
						echo (($getTotalRows > 20) ? "<tr><td colspan='4' style='text-align:right;'><a href='?query=highscores&skill=" . $grabskill . "&startrow=" . $nextDown . "'><img src='" . $web_data['b_img'] . "/arrow_down.png' alt='V' /></a></td></tr>" : null) . "</table>";
					}
					echo "</div></div>";
				}
			}
		break;


Free php combat calc also included in DL:

		case "combat_calculator":
			if(isset($_POST['calccomb']) || isset($_POST['calchits'])){
				$attack = isset($_POST['attack']) && is_numeric($_POST['attack']) && $_POST['attack'] > 0 && strlen($_POST['attack']) <= 2 ? $_POST['attack'] : null;
				$defense = isset($_POST['defense']) && is_numeric($_POST['defense']) && $_POST['defense'] > 0 && strlen($_POST['defense']) <= 2 ? $_POST['defense'] : null;
				$strength = isset($_POST['strength']) && is_numeric($_POST['strength']) && $_POST['strength'] > 0 && strlen($_POST['strength']) <= 2 ? $_POST['strength'] : null;
				$hits = isset($_POST['hits']) && is_numeric($_POST['hits']) && $_POST['hits'] > 0 && strlen($_POST['hits']) <= 2 ? $_POST['hits'] : null;
				$ranged = isset($_POST['ranged']) && is_numeric($_POST['ranged']) && $_POST['ranged'] > 0 && strlen($_POST['ranged']) <= 2 ? $_POST['ranged'] : null;
				$magic = isset($_POST['magic']) && is_numeric($_POST['magic']) && $_POST['magic'] > 0 && strlen($_POST['magic']) <= 2 ? $_POST['magic'] : null;
				$prayer = isset($_POST['prayer']) && is_numeric($_POST['prayer']) && $_POST['prayer'] > 0 && strlen($_POST['prayer']) <= 2 ? $_POST['prayer'] : null;
				/* CALC HITS */
				$totalexp = ($exps[($attack - 2)] + $exps[($defense - 2)] + $exps[($strength - 2)]);
				$divideexp = floor($totalexp / 3) + 1200;
				$convertexp = experience_to_level($divideexp);
				$hplvl = $convertexp;
				/* CALC COMB */
				if(!isset($_POST['calchits'])){
					echo "<div class='table'><div class='header'>Calculated Results</div><div class='content'>";
					if($attack == null || $defense == null || $strength == null || $hits == null || $ranged == null || $magic == null || $prayer == null){
						echo "You either left a field blank or attempted to add bad data.";
					} else {
						$calcatkdefstr = (($attack + $defense + $strength + $hits) * .25);
						$calcmagicprayer = ($magic + $prayer) * 0.125;
						
						if(($attack + $strength) < ($ranged * 1.5)){
							$defhits = ($defense + $hits) * 0.25;
							$fixrange = $ranged * 0.375;
							$newcb = $defhits + $fixrange + $calcmagicprayer;
							$base = 0;
						} else {
							$base = 1;
							$newcb = $calcatkdefstr + $calcmagicprayer;
						}
						$nextcb = floor(($newcb) + 1) - $newcb;
						$nextFightLevel = (floor(($nextcb) / 0.25)) - 1;
						$nextPMLevel = (floor(($nextcb) / 0.125)) - 1;
						$nextRangeLevel = (floor(($nextcb) / 0.375));
						$atkDefAddTo = floor($ranged * 1.5);
						$nextFightLevel = $nextFightLevel < 0 ? 0 : $nextFightLevel;
						$nextPMLevel = $nextPMLevel < 0 ? 0 : $nextPMLevel;
						$nextRangeLevel = $nextRangeLevel < 0 ? 0 : $nextRangeLevel;
						echo "
							<table>
							<tr>
								<td style='width:40%;'>Combat Level</td>
								<td style='width:60%;'><span class='highlighter'>" . $newcb . "</span></td>
							</tr>
							<tr>
								<td style='width:40%;'>Character Base</td>
								<td style='width:60%;'>" . ($base == 0 ? "Ranger" : "Fighter") . "</td>
							</tr>
						";if($hits < 10 || $newcb < 3.5){
						echo "<tr><td valign='top'>Extra Notes</td><td>Administrative character. <br />[ Detected < 10 hp || cblvl < 3.5]</td></tr>"; }
						if($base == 0){
							echo "
								<tr>
									<td valign='top'>You can max out with:</td>
									<td>" . $nextRangeLevel . " more ranged level(s).<br />" . $nextFightLevel . " more defense or hits level(s).<br /> " . $nextPMLevel . " more magic or prayer level(s).
									<br /><br />Because you are primarily a ranger, if you DO NOT raise your ranged level, your attack and strength will have NO effect on your combat level until they add to " . $atkDefAddTo . "


									</td>
								</tr>
							";
						} else {
							echo "
								<tr>
									<td valign='top'>You can max out with:</td>
									<td>" . $nextFightLevel . " more attack, defense, or strength level(s). <br />" . $nextPMLevel . " more magic or prayer level(s).</td>
								</tr>
							";
						}
						echo "
							</table>
						";
					}
					echo "</div></div>";
				}
			}
			echo "
			<form method='post'><div class='table'><div class='header'>Combat Calculator</div><div class='content'>
			<input type='hidden' name='query' value='combat_calculator' />
			<table style='width:75%;margin:auto;'>
			<tr>
				<td style='width:50%;'>Attack</td>
				<td style='width:50%;'><input type='text' maxlength='2' size='2' value='" . (isset($_POST['attack']) && !isset($_POST['clearit']) ? $_POST['attack'] : 1) . "' name='attack' /></td>
			</tr>
			<tr>
				<td style='width:50%;'>Defense</td>
				<td style='width:50%;'><input type='text' maxlength='2' size='2' value='" . (isset($_POST['defense']) && !isset($_POST['clearit']) ? $_POST['defense'] : 1) . "' name='defense' /></td>
			</tr>
			<tr>
				<td style='width:50%;'>Strength</td>
				<td style='width:50%;'><input type='text' maxlength='2' size='2' value='" . (isset($_POST['strength']) && !isset($_POST['clearit']) ? $_POST['strength'] : 1) . "' name='strength' /></td>
			</tr>
			<tr>
				<td style='width:50%;'>Hits</td>
				<td style='width:50%;'>
					<table>
					<tr>
						<td style='width:50%;'><input type='text' maxlength='2' size='2' value='" . (isset($_POST['hits']) && !isset($_POST['clearit']) ? ((isset($_POST['calchits'])) ? $hplvl : $_POST['hits']) : 10) . "' name='hits' /></td>
						<td style='width:50%;'><input type='submit' name='calchits' value='Calc. Hits' /></td>
					</tr>
					</table>
				</td>
			</tr>
			<tr>
				<td style='width:50%;'>Ranged</td>
				<td style='width:50%;'><input type='text' maxlength='2' size='2' value='" . (isset($_POST['ranged']) && !isset($_POST['clearit']) ? $_POST['ranged'] : 1) . "' name='ranged' /></td>
			</tr>
			<tr>
				<td style='width:50%;'>Prayer</td>
				<td style='width:50%;'><input type='text' maxlength='2' size='2' value='" . (isset($_POST['prayer']) && !isset($_POST['clearit']) ? $_POST['prayer'] : 1) . "' name='prayer' /></td>
			</tr>
			<tr>
				<td style='width:50%;'>Magic</td>
				<td style='width:50%;'><input type='text' maxlength='2' size='2' value='" . (isset($_POST['magic']) && !isset($_POST['clearit']) ? $_POST['magic'] : 1) . "' name='magic' /></td>
			</tr>
			<tr>
				<td><input type='submit' name='clearit' value='Set to Defaults' /></td>
				<td><input type='submit' name='calccomb' value='Calculate Combat' /></td>
			</tr>
			</table>";
			echo "</div></div></form>";
		break;

Read full topic
item.source: Fully optimized and cleaned RSCDv25 www (no-forums included)
